required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Respiratory Training in Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Functional Correlations, Utility Model and Effectiveness of Respiratory Training in Low Back Pain: Health and Gender Education

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To determine the effectiveness of bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm visual biofeedback reeducation by ultrasonography in conjunction with high-intensity inspiratory muscle training versus isolated high-intensity inspiratory muscle training in patients with low back pain. Methods: A single blinded randomized clinical trial will be carried out. A total sample of 96 patients with low back pain will be recruited and randomized into 2 groups: one group will be treated by isolated high-intensity inspiratory muscle training during 8 weeks, and another group will be treated with bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm visual biofeedback reeducation by ultrasonography during 6 weeks in conjunction with high-intensity inspiratory muscle training during 8 weeks. Outcome measurements will be diaphragm muscle thickness evaluated by ultrasonography (main outcome measurement), pain intensity, pressure pain threshold, disability, quality of life and respiratory parameters by spirometry, which will be assessed before and after intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline diaphragm muscle thickness at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Diaphragm muscle thickness in centimeters evaluated by ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline pain intensity at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity scores evaluated by the Visual Analogue Scale from 0 (No pain) to 100 millimeters (Worst pain)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline pressure pain threshold at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain threshold in kilograms / squared centimeter evaluated by algometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline disability at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Disability scores evaluated by the self-reported Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire from 0 (no disability) to 24 points (Maximum disability)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline health-related quality of life scores at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life scores evaluated by the self-reported Medical Outcomes Study Short-Form 36 questionnaire from 0 (lowest health-related quality of life) to 100 (highest health-related quality of life)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline respiratory parameters percentage at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory parameters percentage evaluated by spirometry

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm biofeedback reeducation plus inspiratory training

intervention.intervention_name: Bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm ultrasonography reeducation plus inspiratory training
intervention.description: Bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm biofeedback reeducation plus inspiratory training during 6 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Bilateral and simultaneous diaphragm biofeedback reeducation plus inspiratory training

intervention.description: Isolated high-intensity inspiratory muscle training during 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with low back pain during 6 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neural disorders
- Systemic disorders
- Cognitive disorders

investigator.last_name: Ricardo Becerro de Bengoa Vallejo, PhD
